text:
<@UG6LUDECB>, you can set default value inside an array and json object in the default attribute. But it's not working with choice field for example or i don't know. I have opened a topic on the community forum for this, feel free to follow up :slightly_smiling_face:
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Default-values-for-repeatable-fields-do-not-work/m-p/362395>

For your question, i'm using the cta field. it's really good !

<@UV46D6DDY>
Thanks so much! Yeah I know about the default values in the fields.json, however I was wondering if it's possible to do it in a more centralized way, kinda like defining some variables at the beginning of a file if it makes sense.

I want to use HubSpot video in a module using the embed code
```{% video_player "embed_player" overrideable=False, type='scriptV4', hide_playlist=True, viral_sharing=False, embed_button=False, autoplay=False, hidden_controls=False, loop=False, muted=False, full_width=False, width='1920', height='1080', player_id='33324281855', style='', color='CC0201', play_button_color='CC0201' %}```
However if i have a file picker it outputs the url not the id how can i get the id from the url

crosspost from <#C2YH119N2|hubl>

 Are there any tips on using HubSpot CTAS? if I could just pull the link and the content, I would be gtg
 {{ module.cta.href }} or something like that
I have a bunch of markup to get my buttons right and I donâ€™t really want to rely on putting those in the CTA rich text editing field
